page.title: 09GARDENING IN WARDOUR
page.content: Most people in{Wardour}have{gardens. } lots of the gardens are big. They grow {flowers}and{vegetables}in them.{Mr {Wheeler,}a local gardener, spends about{14 hours}in his garden a week. He grows a lot of different vegetables ie{potatoes, beans, lettuce, tomatoes and{spinach}which is the easiest to grow. He enjoys{mowing}and at certain times of the year he mows it more fequently than others. The soil in Wardour is good and it consists of {green sand}and{clay,}most plants can be grown. There are no special pests but there are{green,white}and {black fly}and the{birds}but{spring {frosts}are a problem.{Mrs Wheeler grows many varieties mostly{perenniels She leaves the{weeding}as late as possible so the{butterflies}can breed. {by Lucy,Rebecca and Camilla. {
